titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Lillian F. Robbins certificate from the Regents of the University of the State of New York 1977.414
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was originally processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-11-28 21:24:21 +0000.

did.unittitle: Lillian F. Robbins certificate from the Regents of the University of the State of New York

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: University of the State of New York

did.abstract: One 1872 certificate issued by the Regents of the University of the State of New York stating that Lillian F. Robbins has passed a proficiency exam administered by the Packer Collegiate Institute in Brooklyn.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single item.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Lillian F. Robbins certificate from the Regents of the University of the State of New York, 1977.414, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One certificate issued by the Regents of the University of the State of New York stating that Lillian F. Robbins has passed a proficiency exam administered by the Packer Collegiate Institute in Brooklyn, and has been registered as an academic scholar at the University. The certificate is dated November 1, 1872.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This item is in the public domain. While many items at the Center for Brooklyn History are unrestricted, we do not own reproduction rights to all materials. Be aware of the several kinds of rights that might apply: copyright, licensing and trademarks. The researcher assumes all responsibility for copyright questions.
